BitField.name: OCMPU

Enum.description: OCMEMn is a system RAM.
OCMEMn is a graphics RAM.
OCMEMn is a ROM.
Writes to the OCMDRn[11:0] are allowed
Writes to the OCMDRn[11:0] are ignored

OCMEMn 64-bits wide
no OCMEMn
4KB OCMEMn
8KB OCMEMn
16KB OCMEMn
32KB OCMEMn
8192KB OCMEMn
OCMEMn is a power-of-2 capacity.
OCMEMn is not a power-of-2, with a capacity is 0.75 * OCMSZ.

When in debug mode, the DMA continues to operate.
When in debug mode, the DMA stalls the start of a new channel. Executing channels are allowed to complete. Channel execution resumes when the system exits debug mode or the EDBG bit is cleared.
Fixed priority arbitration is used for channel selection .
Round robin arbitration is used for channel selection .
Normal operation
Any error causes the HALT bit to set. Subsequently, all service requests are ignored until the HALT bit is cleared.
Normal operation
Stall the start of any new channels. Executing channels are allowed to complete. Channel execution resumes when this bit is cleared.
A minor loop channel link made to itself goes through channel arbitration before being activated again.

A minor loop channel link made to itself does not go through channel arbitration before being activated again. Upon minor loop completion, the channel activates again if that channel has a minor loop channel link enabled and the link channel is itself. This effectively applies the minor loop offsets and restarts the next minor loop.
Disabled. TCDn.word2 is defined as a 32-bit NBYTES field.

Enabled. TCDn.word2 is redefined to include individual enable fields, an offset field, and the NBYTES field. The individual enable fields allow the minor loop offset to be applied to the source address, the destination address, or both. The NBYTES field is reduced when either offset is enabled.
Normal operation

Cancel the remaining data transfer in the same fashion as the CX bit. Stop the executing channel and force the minor loop to finish. The cancel takes effect after the last write of the current read/write sequence. The ECX bit clears itself after the cancel is honored. In addition to cancelling the transfer, ECX treats the cancel as an error condition, thus updating the Error Status register (DMAx_ES) and generating an optional error interrupt.
Normal operation

Cancel the remaining data transfer. Stop the executing channel and force the minor loop to finish. The cancel takes effect after the last write of the current read/write sequence. The CX bit clears itself after the cancel has been honored. This cancel retires the channel normally as if the minor loop was completed.
eDMA is idle.
eDMA is executing a channel.
No destination bus error
The last recorded error was a bus error on a destination write
No source bus error
The last recorded error was a bus error on a source read
No scatter/gather configuration error

The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DLASTSGA field. This field is checked at the beginning of a scatter/gather operation after major loop completion if TCDn_CSR[ESG] is enabled. TCDn_DLASTSGA is not on a 32 byte boundary.
No NBYTES/CITER configuration error

The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_NBYTES or TCDn_CITER fields. TCDn_NBYTES is not a multiple of TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE] and TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE], or TCDn_CITER[CITER] is equal to zero, or TCDn_CITER[ELINK] is not equal to TCDn_BITER[ELINK]
No destination offset configuration error
The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DOFF field. TCDn_DOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].
No destination address configuration error
The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_DADDR field. TCDn_DADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[DSIZE].
No source offset configuration error
The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SOFF field. TCDn_SOFF is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].
No source address configuration error.
The last recorded error was a configuration error detected in the TCDn_SADDR field. TCDn_SADDR is inconsistent with TCDn_ATTR[SSIZE].

BitField.name: INTMAJOR
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major iteration count completes.

Enum.description: The end-of-major loop interrupt is disabled.
The end-of-major loop interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: INTHALF
BitField.description: Enable an interrupt when major counter is half complete.

Enum.description: The half-point interrupt is disabled.
The half-point interrupt is enabled.
The channel's ERQ bit is not affected.
The channel's ERQ bit is cleared when the major loop is complete.
The current channel's TCD is normal format.

BitField.name: MGSTAT0
BitField.description: Memory Controller Command Completion Status Flag

Enum.description: No protection violation detected
Protection violation detected
No access error detected
Access error detected
No collision error detected
Collision error detected
Flash command in progress
Flash command has completed
No suspend requested
Suspend the current Erase Flash Sector command execution.
No request or request complete

Request to: run the Erase All Blocks command, verify the erased state, program the security byte in the Flash Configuration Field to the unsecure state, and release MCU security by setting the FSEC[SEC] field to the unsecure state.
Read collision error interrupt disabled
Read collision error interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever a flash memory read collision error is detected (see the description of FSTAT[RDCOLERR]).
Command complete interrupt disabled
Command complete interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever the FSTAT[CCIF] flag is set.
MCU security status is secure.
MCU security status is secure.
MCU security status is unsecure. (The standard shipping condition of the flash memory module is unsecure.)
MCU security status is secure.
NXP factory access granted
NXP factory access denied
NXP factory access denied
NXP factory access granted
Mass erase is enabled
Mass erase is enabled
Mass erase is disabled
Mass erase is enabled
Backdoor key access disabled
Backdoor key access disabled (preferred KEYEN state to disable backdoor key access)
Backdoor key access enabled
Backdoor key access disabled

BitField.name: TOFDIR
BitField.description: Indicates if the TOF bit was set on the top or the bottom of counting.

Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the bottom of counting. There was an FTM counter decrement and FTM counter changes from its minimum value (zero) to its maximum value (MOD register).
TOF bit was set on the top of counting. There was an FTM counter increment and FTM counter changes from its maximum value (MOD register) to its minimum value (zero).

BitField.name: QUADIR
BitField.description: Counter Direction in Quadrature Decode Mode

Enum.description: Counter direction is decreasing (counter decrement).
Counter direction is increasing (counter increment).
Phase encoding mode.
Count and direction encoding mode.
Internal TPM counter continues in Doze mode.
Internal TPM counter is paused and does not increment during Doze mode. Trigger inputs and input capture events are also ignored.
TPM counter is paused and does not increment during debug mode. Trigger inputs and input capture events are also ignored.
TPM counter continues in debug mode.
Global timebase synchronization disabled.
Global timebase synchronization enabled.
All channels use the internally generated TPM counter as their timebase
All channels use an externally generated global timebase as their timebase
TPM counter starts to increment immediately, once it is enabled.
TPM counter only starts to increment when it a rising edge on the selected input trigger is detected, after it has been enabled or after it has stopped due to overflow.
TPM counter continues incrementing or decrementing after overflow
TPM counter stops incrementing or decrementing after overflow.
Counter is not reloaded due to a rising edge on the selected input trigger
Counter is reloaded when a rising edge is detected on the selected input trigger
Trigger is active high.
Trigger is active low.
Trigger source selected by TRGSEL is external.
Trigger source selected by TRGSEL is internal (channel pin input capture).
Standard feature set.
Standard feature set with Filter and Combine registers implemented.
Standard feature set with Filter, Combine and Quadrature registers implemented.
Module is not reset.
Module is reset.

BitField.name: TOFDIR
BitField.description: Indicates if the TOF bit was set on the top or the bottom of counting.

Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the bottom of counting. There was an FTM counter decrement and FTM counter changes from its minimum value (zero) to its maximum value (MOD register).
TOF bit was set on the top of counting. There was an FTM counter increment and FTM counter changes from its maximum value (MOD register) to its minimum value (zero).

BitField.name: QUADIR
BitField.description: Counter Direction in Quadrature Decode Mode

Resets all RTC registers except for the SWR bit . The SWR bit is cleared by POR and by software explicitly clearing it.
Wakeup pin is disabled.
Wakeup pin is enabled and wakeup pin asserts if the RTC interrupt asserts or the wakeup pin is turned on.
Non-supervisor mode write accesses are not supported and generate a bus error.
Non-supervisor mode write accesses are supported.
Registers cannot be written when locked.
Registers can be written when locked under limited conditions.
Wakeup pin asserts (active low, open drain) if the RTC interrupt asserts or the wakeup pin is turned on.
Wakeup pin instead outputs the RTC 32kHz clock, provided the wakeup pin is turned on and the 32kHz clock is output to other peripherals.
The prescaler output clock (as configured by TSIC) is output on RTC_CLKOUT.
The RTC 32kHz crystal clock is output on RTC_CLKOUT.
RTC prescaler increments using 32kHz crystal.
RTC prescaler increments using 1kHz LPO, bits [4:0] of the prescaler are bypassed.
32.768 kHz oscillator is disabled.
32.768 kHz oscillator is enabled. After setting this bit, wait the oscillator startup time before enabling the time counter to allow the 32.768 kHz clock time to stabilize.
The 32 kHz clock is output to other peripherals.
The 32 kHz clock is not output to other peripherals.
Disable the load.
Enable the additional load.
Disable the load.
Enable the additional load.
Disable the load.
Enable the additional load.

Enable the additional load.

Time counter is enabled.

Status Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.
Lock Register is locked and writes are ignored.
Lock Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

Time invalid flag does generate an interrupt.
Time overflow flag does not generate an interrupt.
Time overflow flag does generate an interrupt.
Time alarm flag does not generate an interrupt.
Time alarm flag does generate an interrupt.

Seconds interrupt is enabled.
No effect.

Parity error.

No overrun.
Receive overrun (new LPUART data lost).
No idle line detected.
Idle line was detected.
Receive data buffer empty.
Receive data buffer full.
Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).
Transmitter idle (transmission activity complete).
Transmit data buffer full.
Transmit data buffer empty.
LPUART receiver idle waiting for a start bit.
LPUART receiver active (LPUART_RX input not idle).
Break character is detected at length 10 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 11 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 13 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).
Break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 14 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 15 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).

Break character is transmitted with length of 10 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 11 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 13 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).

Break character is transmitted with length of 13 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 14 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 15 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 16 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).
During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not get set when an address does not match.
During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does get set when an address does not match.
Receive data not inverted.
Receive data inverted.
LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of CTRL[M] and CTRL[PE].

BitField.name: TXDIR
BitField.description: LPUART_TX Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode

Enum.description: LPUART_TX pin is an input in single-wire mode.
LPUART_TX pin is an output in single-wire mode.

BitField.name: R0T0
BitField.description: Read receive data buffer 0 or write transmit data buffer 0.

BitField.name: R1T1
BitField.description: Read receive data buffer 1 or write transmit data buffer 1.

BitField.name: R2T2
BitField.description: Read receive data buffer 2 or write transmit data buffer 2.

BitField.name: R3T3
BitField.description: Read receive data buffer 3 or write transmit data buffer 3.

BitField.description: Read receive data buffer 4 or write transmit data buffer 4.

BitField.name: R9T9
BitField.description: Read receive data buffer 9 or write transmit data buffer 9.

Enum.description: Receiver was not idle before receiving this character.
Receiver was idle before receiving this character.
Receive buffer contains valid data.
Receive buffer is empty, data returned on read is not valid.
The dataword was received without a frame error on read, transmit a normal character on write.
The dataword was received with a frame error, transmit an idle or break character on transmit.

BitField.name: PARITYE
BitField.description: The current received dataword contained in DATA[R9:R0] was received with a parity error.

Enum.description: The dataword was received without a parity error.
The dataword was received with a parity error.

BitField.name: NOISY
BitField.description: The current received dataword contained in DATA[R9:R0] was received with noise.

Enum.description: The dataword was received without noise.
The data was received with noise.
CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.
The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.
Transmitter RTS is active low.
Transmitter RTS is active high.
The receiver has no effect on RTS.
RTS assertion is configured by the RTSWATER field
CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.
CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.
CTS input is the LPUART_CTS pin.
CTS input is the inverted Receiver Match result.
RTS asserts when the receiver FIFO is full or receiving a character that causes the FIFO to become full.
RTS asserts when the receive FIFO is less than or equal to the RXWATER configuration and negates when the receive FIFO is greater than the RXWATER configuration.
IR disabled.
IR enabled.

Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords.

Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.
Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.
Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords

Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.
RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.
RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.
TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.
TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.
Disable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle.
Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 1 character.
Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 2 characters.
Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 4 characters.
Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 8 characters.
Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 16 characters.

Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 64 characters.

All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.
No flush operation occurs.
All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.
No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.
Receive buffer is not empty.
Receive buffer is empty.
Transmit buffer is not empty.
Transmit buffer is empty.
Standard feature set.
Standard feature set with MODEM/IrDA support.
Module is not reset.
Module is reset.
Input trigger is disabled.
Input trigger is used instead of RXD pin input.
Input trigger is used instead of CTS pin input.
Input trigger is used to modulate the TXD pin output.
One stop bit.
Two stop bits.

Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] disabled (use polling).
Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[RXEDGIF] flag is 1.
Hardware interrupts from LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] disabled (use polling).
Hardware interrupt requested when LPUART_STAT[LBKDIF] flag is 1.
Resynchronization during received data word is supported
Resynchronization during received data word is disabled
Receiver samples input data using the rising edge of the baud rate clock.
Receiver samples input data using the rising and falling edge of the baud rate clock.
Address Match Wakeup
Idle Match Wakeup
Match On and Match Off
Enables RWU on Data Match and Match On/Off for transmitter CTS input
DMA request disabled.
DMA request enabled.
DMA request disabled.
DMA request enabled.
Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit or 9-bit data characters.
Receiver and transmitter use 10-bit data characters.
Normal operation.
Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA2].
Normal operation.
Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA1].
Received data is not equal to MA2
Received data is equal to MA2
Received data is not equal to MA1
Received data is equal to MA1
No parity error.
Parity error.
No framing error detected. This does not guarantee the framing is correct.
Framing error.
No noise detected.
Noise detected in the received character in LPUART_DATA.
No overrun.
Receive overrun (new LPUART data lost).
No idle line detected.
Idle line was detected.
Receive data buffer empty.
Receive data buffer full.
Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).
Transmitter idle (transmission activity complete).
Transmit data buffer full.
Transmit data buffer empty.
LPUART receiver idle waiting for a start bit.
LPUART receiver active (LPUART_RX input not idle).
Break character is detected at length 10 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 11 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 13 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).
Break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 14 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 15 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).

Break character is transmitted with length of 10 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 11 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 13 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).

Break character is transmitted with length of 13 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 14 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 15 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 16 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).
During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not get set when an address does not match.
During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does get set when an address does not match.
Receive data not inverted.
Receive data inverted.
LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of CTRL[M] and CTRL[PE].

BitField.name: INV_CRC_VAL
BitField.description: Invert bits in the CRC Output Value

Enum.description: Bits in CRC Output value will not be inverted.

BitField.description: CRC Output Value Bit Reversal or Flip

Enum.description: Bits within the CRC output bytes will not be reversed i.e. 15:0 will remain 15:0 (default)
Bits within the CRC output bytes will be reversed i.e. 15:0 will become {8:15,0:7}

BitField.name: CRC_IN_FLIP
BitField.description: CRC Input Byte's Bit Reversal or Flip Control

Enum.description: Bits in the input byte will not be reversed (i.e. 7:0 will remain 7:0) before the CRC calculation (default)
Bits in the input byte will be reversed (i.e. 7:0 will become 0:7) before CRC calculation

Register.name: EMVSIM0_GPCNT0_VAL
Register.description: General Purpose Counter 0 Timeout Value Register

RegisterGroup.name: USB0
RegisterGroup.description: Universal Serial Bus, OTG Capable Controller

BitField.name: IEHOST
BitField.description: This bit is set if host mode is enabled.

BitField.name: LINE_STATE_CHG
BitField.description: This interrupt is set when the USB line state (CTL[SE0] and CTL[JSTATE] bits) are stable without change for 1 millisecond, and the value of the line state is different from the last time when the line state was stable

BitField.name: ONEMSEC
BitField.description: This bit is set when the 1 millisecond timer expires

Enum.description: Disables the LINE_STAT_CHG interrupt.
Enables the LINE_STAT_CHG interrupt.
Diables the 1ms timer interrupt.
Enables the 1ms timer interrupt.

BitField.name: LINESTATESTABLE
BitField.description: Indicates that the internal signals that control the LINE_STATE_CHG field of OTGISTAT are stable for at least 1 ms

Enum.description: The LINE_STAT_CHG bit is not yet stable.
The LINE_STAT_CHG bit has been debounced and is stable.

BitField.name: ONEMSECEN
BitField.description: This bit is reserved for the 1ms count, but it is not useful to software.

Enum.description: If USB_EN is 1 and HOST_MODE is 0 in the Control Register (CTL), then the D+ Data Line pull-up resistors are enabled. If HOST_MODE is 1 the D+ and D- Data Line pull-down resistors are engaged.
The pull-up and pull-down controls in this register are used.

BitField.name: DMLOW
BitField.description: D- Data Line pull-down resistor enable

Enum.description: D- pulldown resistor is not enabled.
D- pulldown resistor is enabled.

BitField.name: DPLOW
BitField.description: D+ Data Line pull-down resistor enable

Enum.description: D+ pulldown resistor is not enabled.
D+ pulldown resistor is enabled.

BitField.name: DPHIGH
BitField.description: D+ Data Line pullup resistor enable

Enum.description: D+ pullup resistor is not enabled
D+ pullup resistor is enabled

BitField.name: USBRST
BitField.description: This bit is set when the USB Module has decoded a valid USB reset

BitField.name: ERROR
BitField.description: This bit is set when any of the error conditions within Error Interrupt Status (ERRSTAT) register occur

BitField.name: SOFTOK
BitField.description: This bit is set when the USB Module receives a Start Of Frame (SOF) token

BitField.name: TOKDNE
BitField.description: This bit is set when the current token being processed has completed

BitField.name: SLEEP
BitField.description: This bit is set when the USB Module detects a constant idle on the USB bus for 3 ms

BitField.name: RESUME
BitField.description: This bit is set when a K-state is observed on the DP/DM signals for 2

Enum.description: No Attach is detected since the last time the ATTACH bit was cleared.
A peripheral is now present and must be configured (a stable non-SE0 state is detected for more than 2.5 us).
Disables the USBRST interrupt.
Enables the USBRST interrupt.
Disables the ERROR interrupt.
Enables the ERROR interrupt.
Disbles the SOFTOK interrupt.
Enables the SOFTOK interrupt.
Disables the TOKDNE interrupt.
Enables the TOKDNE interrupt.
Disables the SLEEP interrupt.
Enables the SLEEP interrupt.
Disables the RESUME interrupt.
Enables the RESUME interrupt.
Disables the ATTACH interrupt.
Enables the ATTACH interrupt.
Diasbles the STALL interrupt.
Enables the STALL interrupt.

BitField.name: PIDERR
BitField.description: This bit is set when the PID check field fails.

BitField.name: CRC5EOF
BitField.description: This error interrupt has two functions

BitField.name: CRC16
BitField.description: This bit is set when a data packet is rejected due to a CRC16 error.

BitField.name: DFN8
BitField.description: This bit is set if the data field received was not 8 bits in length

BitField.name: BTOERR
BitField.description: This bit is set when a bus turnaround timeout error occurs

BitField.name: DMAERR
BitField.description: This bit is set if the USB Module has requested a DMA access to read a new BDT but has not been given the bus before it needs to receive or transmit data

BitField.name: OWNERR
BitField.description: This field is valid when the USB Module is operating in peripheral mode (CTL[HOSTMODEEN]=0)

BitField.name: BTSERR
BitField.description: This bit is set when a bit stuff error is detected

Enum.description: Disables the PIDERR interrupt.
Enters the PIDERR interrupt.
Disables the CRC5/EOF interrupt.
Enables the CRC5/EOF interrupt.
Disables the CRC16 interrupt.
Enables the CRC16 interrupt.
Disables the DFN8 interrupt.
Enables the DFN8 interrupt.
Disables the BTOERR interrupt.
Enables the BTOERR interrupt.
Disables the DMAERR interrupt.
Enables the DMAERR interrupt.
Disables the OWNERR interrupt.
Enables the OWNERR interrupt.
Disables the BTSERR interrupt.
Enables the BTSERR interrupt.

BitField.name: ODD
BitField.description: This bit is set if the last buffer descriptor updated was in the odd bank of the BDT.

Enum.description: The most recent transaction was a receive operation.
The most recent transaction was a transmit operation.

BitField.name: ENDP
BitField.description: This four-bit field encodes the endpoint address that received or transmitted the previous token

Enum.description: Disables the USB Module.
Enables the USB Module.

BitField.name: ODDRST
BitField.description: Setting this bit to 1 resets all the BDT ODD ping/pong fields to 0, which then specifies the EVEN BDT bank

BitField.name: RESUME
BitField.description: When set to 1 this bit enables the USB Module to execute resume signaling

BitField.name: HOSTMODEEN
BitField.description: When set to 1, this bit enables the USB Module to operate in Host mode

BitField.name: RESET
BitField.description: Setting this bit enables the USB Module to generate USB reset signaling

BitField.name: TXSUSPENDTOKENBUSY
BitField.description: In Host mode, TOKEN_BUSY is set when the USB module is busy executing a USB token

BitField.name: SE0
BitField.description: Live USB Single Ended Zero signal

BitField.name: JSTATE
BitField.description: Live USB differential receiver JSTATE signal

BitField.name: BDTBA
BitField.description: Provides address bits 15 through 9 of the BDT base address.

BitField.name: FRM
BitField.description: This 8-bit field and the 3-bit field in the Frame Number Register High are used to compute the address where the current Buffer Descriptor Table (BDT) resides in system memory

BitField.name: FRM
BitField.description: This 3-bit field and the 8-bit field in the Frame Number Register Low are used to compute the address where the current Buffer Descriptor Table (BDT) resides in system memory

BitField.name: TOKENENDPT
BitField.description: Holds the Endpoint address for the token command

BitField.name: TOKENPID
BitField.description: Contains the token type executed by the USB module.

Enum.description: OUT Token. USB Module performs an OUT (TX) transaction.
IN Token. USB Module performs an In (RX) transaction.
SETUP Token. USB Module performs a SETUP (TX) transaction

BitField.name: CNT
BitField.description: Represents the SOF count threshold in byte times when SOFDYNTHLD=0 or 8 byte times when SOFDYNTHLD=1

BitField.name: BDTBA
BitField.description: Provides address bits 23 through 16 of the BDT base address that defines the location of Buffer Descriptor Table resides in system memory

BitField.name: BDTBA
BitField.description: Provides address bits 31 through 24 of the BDT base address that defines the location of Buffer Descriptor Table resides in system memory

BitField.name: EPHSHK
BitField.description: When set this bit enables an endpoint to perform handshaking during a transaction to this endpoint

BitField.name: EPSTALL
BitField.description: When set, this bit indicates that the endpoint is stalled

BitField.name: EPTXEN
BitField.description: This bit, when set, enables the endpoint for TX transfers. See

BitField.name: EPRXEN
BitField.description: This bit, when set, enables the endpoint for RX transfers. See

BitField.name: EPCTLDIS
BitField.description: This bit, when set, disables control (SETUP) transfers

BitField.name: RETRYDIS
BitField.description: This is a Host mode only bit and is present in the control register for endpoint 0 (ENDPT0) only

BitField.name: HOSTWOHUB
BitField.description: Host without a hub This is a Host mode only field and is present in the control register for endpoint 0 (ENDPT0) only

Enum.description: Low-speed device connected to Host through a hub. PRE_PID will be generated as required.
Low-speed device directly connected. No hub, or no low-speed device attached.

BitField.name: EPTXEN
BitField.description: This bit, when set, enables the endpoint for TX transfers. See

BitField.name: EPRXEN
BitField.description: This bit, when set, enables the endpoint for RX transfers. See

BitField.name: EPCTLDIS
BitField.description: This bit, when set, disables control (SETUP) transfers

BitField.name: RETRYDIS
BitField.description: This is a Host mode only bit and is present in the control register for endpoint 0 (ENDPT0) only

BitField.name: HOSTWOHUB
BitField.description: Host without a hub This is a Host mode only field and is present in the control register for endpoint 0 (ENDPT0) only

Enum.description: Low-speed device connected to Host through a hub. PRE_PID will be generated as required.
Low-speed device directly connected. No hub, or no low-speed device attached.

BitField.name: UARTSEL
BitField.description: Selects USB signals to be used as UART signals.

Enum.description: USB signals not used as UART signals.
USB signals used as UART signals.
USB DP/DM signals used as UART TX/RX.
USB DP/DM signals used as UART RX/TX.

BitField.name: PDE
BitField.description: Enables the weak pulldowns on the USB transceiver.

Enum.description: Weak pulldowns are disabled on D+ and D-.
Weak pulldowns are enabled on D+ and D-.

BitField.name: SUSP
BitField.description: Places the USB transceiver into the suspend state.

Enum.description: USB transceiver is not in suspend state.
USB transceiver is in suspend state.

BitField.name: DMPD
BitField.description: Provides observability of the D- Pulldown enable at the USB transceiver.

Enum.description: D- pulldown disabled.
D- pulldown enabled.

BitField.name: DPPD
BitField.description: Provides observability of the D+ Pulldown enable at the USB transceiver.

Enum.description: D+ pulldown disabled.
D+ pulldown enabled.

BitField.name: DPPU
BitField.description: Provides observability of the D+ Pullup enable at the USB transceiver.

Enum.description: D+ pullup disabled.
D+ pullup enabled.

BitField.name: DPPULLUPNONOTG
BitField.description: Provides control of the DP Pullup in USBOTG, if USB is configured in non-OTG device mode.

Enum.description: DP Pullup in non-OTG device mode is not enabled.
DP Pullup in non-OTG device mode is enabled.
No interrupt was generated.
Interrupt was generated because of the USB asynchronous interrupt.
Synchronous interrupt has not been detected.
Synchronous interrupt has been detected.

BitField.name: USB_CLK_RECOVERY_INT
BitField.description: Combined USB Clock Recovery interrupt status

Enum.description: VREGIN rising edge interrupt has not been detected.
VREGIN rising edge interrupt has been detected.
VREGIN falling edge interrupt has not been detected.
VREGIN falling edge interrupt has been detected.
USB asynchronous wakeup from suspend mode disabled.

USB asynchronous wakeup from suspend mode enabled. The asynchronous resume interrupt differs from the synchronous resume interrupt in that it asynchronously detects K-state using the unfiltered state of the D+ and D- pins. This interrupt should only be enabled when the Transceiver is suspended.
Normal USB module operation.
Returns the USB module to its reset state.
SOF_TOK interrupt is set when byte times SOF threshold is reached.
SOF_TOK interrupt is set when 8 byte times SOF threshold is reached or overstepped.
SOF_TOK interrupt is set according to SOF threshold value.
SOF_TOK interrupt is set when SOF counter reaches 0.

BitField.name: OWNERRISODIS
BitField.description: OWN Error Detect for ISO IN / ISO OUT Disable

Enum.description: OWN error detect for ISO IN / ISO OUT is not disabled.
OWN error detect for ISO IN / ISO OUT is disabled.
VREGIN rising edge interrupt disabled.
VREGIN rising edge interrupt enabled.
VREGIN falling edge interrupt disabled.
VREGIN falling edge interrupt enabled.
Trim fine adjustment always works based on the previous updated trim fine value (default)
Trim fine restarts from the IFR trim value whenever bus_reset/bus_resume is detected or module enable is desasserted
Always works in tracking phase after the first time rough to track transition (default)
Go back to rough stage whenever bus reset or bus resume occurs
Disable clock recovery block (default)
Enable clock recovery block

BitField.name: OVF_ERROR_EN
BitField.description: Determines whether OVF_ERROR condition signal is used in generation of USB_CLK_RECOVERY_INT.

Enum.description: The interrupt will be masked
The interrupt will be enabled (default)

BitField.name: OVF_ERROR
BitField.description: Indicates that the USB clock recovery algorithm has detected that the frequency trim adjustment needed for the FIRC output clock is outside the available TRIM_FINE adjustment range for the FIRC module

Enum.description: No interrupt is reported
Unmasked interrupt has been generated
Internal pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

Open drain output is disabled on the corresponding pin.
Open drain output is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital output.

Configured interrupt is not detected.

Configured interrupt is detected. If the pin is configured to generate a DMA request, then the corresponding flag will be cleared automatically at the completion of the requested DMA transfer. Otherwise, the flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

BitField.name: TF1BR0

BitField.name: TF2BR0

BitField.name: TF2BR1

BitField.name: TF3BR0

BitField.name: TF4BR0
BitField.description: Test Fail, 4-Bit Run, Sampling 0s. If TF4BR0=1, the 4-Bit Run, Sampling 0s Test has failed.

BitField.name: TF4BR1
BitField.description: Test Fail, 4-Bit Run, Sampling 1s. If TF4BR1=1, the 4-Bit Run, Sampling 1s Test has failed.

BitField.name: TF5BR0

BitField.name: REVISION
BitField.description: Minor revision number m in the rnpm revision status

BitField.name: VARIANT
BitField.description: Major revision number n in the npm revision status

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

Enum.description: no effect
removes the pending state from the SysTick exception
write: no effect; read: SysTick exception is not pending
write: changes SysTick exception state to pending; read: SysTick exception is pending
no effect
removes the pending state from the PendSV exception
write: no effect; read: PendSV exception is not pending
write: changes PendSV exception state to pending; read: PendSV exception is pending
write: no effect; read: NMI exception is not pending
write: changes NMI exception state to pending; read: NMI exception is pending

Register.name: SCB_AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

Enum.description: no system reset request
asserts a signal to the outer system that requests a reset

BitField.name: SLEEPONEXIT
BitField.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

Enum.description: do not sleep when returning to Thread mode
enter sleep, or deep sleep, on return from an ISR

BitField.name: SLEEPDEEP
BitField.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

Enum.description: deep sleep
only enabled interrupts or events can wakeup the processor, disabled interrupts are excluded
enabled events and all interrupts, including disabled interrupts, can wakeup the processor

BitField.name: UNALIGN_TRP
BitField.description: Always reads as one, indicates that all unaligned accesses generate a HardFault

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

BitField.name: PRI_15
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 15, SysTick exception

Register.name: SCB_SHCSR
Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

Enum.description: exception is not pending
exception is pending
No active halt request debug event
Halt request debug event active
No current breakpoint debug event
At least one current breakpoint debug event
No current debug events generated by the DWT
At least one current debug event generated by the DWT
No Vector catch triggered
Vector catch triggered
No EDBGRQ debug event
EDBGRQ debug event
counter disabled
counter enabled
counting down to 0 does not assert the SysTick exception request
counting down to 0 asserts the SysTick exception request
external clock
processor clock

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: Value to load into the SysTick Current Value Register when the counter reaches 0

BitField.name: CURRENT
BitField.description: Current value at the time the register is accessed

BitField.name: TENMS
BitField.description: Reload value to use for 10ms timing

Enum.description: 10ms calibration value is exact
10ms calibration value is inexact, because of the clock frequency
The reference clock is provided
The reference clock is not provided

Perform address comparison.
Perform data value comparison.

Match occurred.

BitField.name: ASC
BitField.description: Each bit in the ASC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the crossbar switch's slave input port.

Enum.description: A bus slave connection to AXBS input port n is absent.
A bus slave connection to AXBS input port n is present.

BitField.name: AMC
BitField.description: Each bit in the AMC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the AXBS master input port.

Enum.description: A bus master connection to AXBS input port n is absent
A bus master connection to AXBS input port n is present
MMCAU is disabled
MMCAU is enabled
Fixed-priority arbitration for the crossbar masters
Round-robin arbitration for the crossbar masters
Enable flash controller data caching
Disable flash controller data caching.
Enable flash controller instruction caching.
Disable flash controller instruction caching.
Enable flash controller cache.
Disable flash controller cache.
Disable flash data speculation.
Enable flash data speculation.
Enable flash controller speculation.
Disable flash controller speculation.
Disable stalling flash controller when flash is busy.
Enable stalling flash controller when flash is busy.
Request is cleared.
Request Compute Operation.
Compute operation entry has not completed or compute operation exit has completed.
Compute operation entry has completed or compute operation exit has not completed.
No effect.
When set, the CPOREQ is cleared on any interrupt or exception vector fetch.
No operation initiated
If CSR[DFS] = 1, then initiate a divide calculation, else ignore
Perform a signed divide
Perform an unsigned divide
Return the quotient in the RES for the divide calculation
Return the remainder in the RES for the divide calculation
Reads of the RES register return the register contents
If CSR[DZ] = 1, an attempted read of RES register is error terminated to signal a divide-by-zero, else the register contents are returned
The last divide operation had a non-zero divisor, that is, DSOR != 0
The last divide operation had a zero divisor, that is, DSOR = 0
A divide operation is initiated by a write to the DSOR register
A divide operation is initiated by a write to the CSR register with CSR[SRT] = 1
Current or last MMDVSQ operation was not a square root
Current or last MMDVSQ operation was a square root
Current or last MMDVSQ operation was not a divide
Current or last MMDVSQ operation was a divide
MMDVSQ is idle
MMDVSQ is busy performing a divide or square root calculation

Enum.description: Logic level 0 is driven on pin, provided pin is configured for general-purpose output.
Logic level 1 is driven on pin, provided pin is configured for general-purpose output.
Corresponding bit in PDORn does not change.
Corresponding bit in PDORn is set to logic 1.
Corresponding bit in PDORn does not change.
Corresponding bit in PDORn is cleared to logic 0.
Corresponding bit in PDORn does not change.
Corresponding bit in PDORn is set to the inverse of its existing logic state.
Pin logic level is logic 0, or is not configured for use by digital function.
Pin logic level is logic 1.
Pin is configured as general-purpose input, for the GPIO function.
Pin is configured as general-purpose output, for the GPIO function.
